{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3526547,"name":"allison zhang","username":"sink","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sink/{size}/237947_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-13T23:01:54.684Z","cooked":"

We are using MAX swerve, and everything is fine except that strafing is inverted(controller left x). I have gone through these guides.

What should I try?

Github

(I removed some negative signs to make driving work in teleop on lines 99 and 120 in Bindings.java; closed loop is still inverted)

(Also, I’d like to mention that REV’s swerve template worked perfectly fine without any changes)

| YAGSL","clicks":2},{"url":"https://github.com/REVrobotics/MAXSwerve-Java-Template","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - REVrobotics/MAXSwerve-Java-Template","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69472,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/yagsl-swerve-is-inverted-sideways/491611/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3526560,"name":"Patricia Beekman","username":"pabeekm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pabeekm/{size}/7077_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-13T23:16:06.164Z","cooked":"

I see in Bindings.java that you’re already inverting the controller’s y on line 98. Is it possible that your x-strafing is actually correct (and it’s your starting orientation / y-strafing that’s off?).

Otherwise, negating the controller’s x input should solve your problem.

EDIT: looking at other swerve code, it seems that the norm is to negate both controller input axis. So just re-insert that negative sign on line 99/120.

The way the code is now has the drive fine in teleop, but not in autos. Would modifying the drive method at line 516 of SwerveSubsystem.java work? What should I change if so?

If it’s moving side-to-side wrong in auto, my suspicion would be that it thinks you’re on the opposing alliance or facing the opposing alliance wall (hence the orientation being flipped). You may need to change the default alliance orientations (ex: by updating zeroGyroWithAlliance) or make sure you’re running an auto that doesn’t flip your orientation.

Wouldn’t every direction be inverted then? I will try the auto again as soon as I can.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-02-13T23:57:30.117Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":25,"readers_count":24,"score":10.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":491611,"topic_slug":"yagsl-swerve-is-inverted-sideways","display_username":"allison zhang","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":22664,"username":"pabeekm","name":"Patricia Beekman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pabeekm/{size}/7077_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69472,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/yagsl-swerve-is-inverted-sideways/491611/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3526588,"name":"Patricia Beekman","username":"pabeekm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pabeekm/{size}/7077_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-13T23:59:41.301Z","cooked":"

It depends on how your origin is defined. For example, if 0,0 is always the bottom blue alliance corner, and the robot starts facing an alliance wall, if you tell the robot in auto to move side-to-side, those’ll produce opposite movements in a field-relative system depending on if the robot thinks it started out facing the red or blue alliance wall. The other axis remains the same.

What coordinate system and starting orientation does your auto and teleop each assume? I assume one of those conflicts.
